snippet: After Maya Ranot’s parents were charged with abusing her, the New York City Administration for Children Services claimed that it had helped rescue her. But it was far from an agency success.
abstract: Examination by The New York Times of Maya Ranot abuse case finds that it is far from the agency success that the New York City Administration for Children’s Services claimed; investigation shows that a city social worker had actually been watching her for more than a year but did not act beforehand to rescue her from her parents, who have since been charged with abusing her.
lead_paragraph: After Maya Ranot’s parents were charged with abusing her, the New York City Administration for Children Services claimed that it had helped rescue her. But it was far from an agency success.

headline.main: Missed Signs in a Bloodied Girl’s Abuse Case
headline.print_headline: Missed Signs in a Bloodied Girl’s Abuse Case
